posts.title: US cancels more than $700 million funding for Moderna bird flu vaccine
top_comments:
> Moderna in January was awarded $590 million by the Biden administration to advance the development of its bird flu vaccine, and support the expansion of clinical studies for up to five additional subtypes of pandemic influenza

Cancelled by the Trump administration just 4 months later.
How does the Executive Branch keep cancelling Congressionally-appropriated funds with no consequences?
Dumb bastards.  An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure.
The pharmaceutical industry will respond with - checks notes - massive donations to current and future Republicans, including Trump.
Really need them to clarify that this is the Trump admin and not just “US” start putting his name in the headlines
Then when there's another bird flu epidemic Maga is going to be scratching their heads and bend over backwards not to blame trump
Why would Joe Biden do this to us?
Is this going to bring down the price of chicken?
Really don’t get how they can just decide to not pay things already contracted

Trump learned absolutely NOTHING from gutting the Obama Pandemic Defense program and gutting the CDC by 80% right before Covid hit, then we as taxpayers had to pay his Hospital Covid bill of $11 MILLION DOLLARS due to the extreme lifesaving measures that had to be taken to save him in Dec 2020.  This guy is responsible for more American deaths than the Vietnam war.

posts.title: US judge allows states' lawsuit against DOGE to proceed
top_comments: I won't be surprised if the eventual accounting shows that Elon Musk cost the United States, in law suits for illegal firings, broken contracts, and all the other nonsense "DOGE" has done, a great deal more than any imagined "savings".
Impeach the judge request incoming and another truth social rant post.
Hope something comes out of it, not expecting much.
Something something taco.
This whole fiasco is going to cost us so much.

The judge is Tanya Chutkan, whom Trump escaped in the J6 case in Washington, with Jack Smith of DOJ prosecuting. She is an Obama nominee. 

Judge Chutkan is a Black woman who was born in Kingston, Jamaica and came here at 17. She is a tough, competent jurist, a former public defender. In a 2021 ruling, she said "Presidents are not kings, and Plaintiff is not President.” 

Musk has no immunity, and he has no privilege to withhold documents or other evidence. He has committed crimes, and if he is deposed, he will take the Fifth. 

Hugely important case with massive resources from Blue State AG's Office. DOJ is investigating Letitia James, the NY AG who beat Trump in his NY civil fraud case.
Do you suppose this might hurt Leon’s fragile feelings?  He just doesn’t understand why some people hate him.
News flash to MAGA:  Trump is not a king, he's just your fantasy of one.
The story of how Elon Musk of all people worked his way into Donald Trump's inner circle is going to be an excellent Netflix series in 2035.  Truely frightening times we live in.
Theres no wins until someones hold accountable so whatever

posts.title: Police officers who pepper-sprayed and tasered 92 year old amputee in care home cleared of assault.
top_comments:
[Moment Pensioner Pepper Sprayed And Tasered By Police](https://youtu.be/pqyH9eORA24)   
   
Video is on YouTube.
Reminds me of way back when, houston pd killed a 1 armed man in a wheel chair for weilding a pencil. The police claimed to fear for their lives

How hearty was the 92 year old?

We talking heihachi or junior soprano?
How is that even possible?!? What a broken system!
Before busting out the pitchforks in the US, this was in the UK. Poor training knows no borders.
Well done officers, taking down an armed and very mobile OAP.. cunts
Gonna be honest, I expected this to be a US story.
You see, that 92 year-old could've been a serious threat...
Because it isn't clarified in the headline - This took place in the United Kingdom.

Oh no, what a horribly dangerous situation that couldn't literally just be solved by closing the door and waiting until he got bored.

And they wonder why police are getting less and less respect.

and the oligarchs laugh about it. 

and idiots vote for the con men grifters who tell you that other poor people are the reason you can't have fair wages and healthcare when in fact it's greedy billionaires who pay to buy politicians to keep them from paying taxes.

 So feeding the hungry is out of the question.
With the Big Beautiful Bill we are gonna see this get so much worse.

Iowa carried Trump and voted Chuck Grassley BACK in and have voted Joni Ernst in MANY times. They are a red state about to find out that voting/not voting has consequences. Maybe all of those farmers who voted the criminal in should be donating to the food pantries. Oh that’s right, he screwed them too. Of course they are banking on him coming thru with handouts like he did last term.
56% of votes were for this.
My son is making bread today because we don't have money to go to the grocery store. Glad we had the flour.
Just go out and farm for $4 per hour, like Trump says! Or work in a factory sewing a button on a shirt for $50 a day.

Weird how the christians haven't stepped up to fill the void. Their churches have tax exempt status specifically for this purpose. It's almost like they've been lying this entire time and now that they have a chance to prove themselves, they're failing to. Who could have guessed this would happen?
Keep starving, the golden age is just around the corner. Maybe get out in the fields and start picking? I’m sure things will improve with the big bullshit bill getting signed into law.

posts.title: FEMA rescinds strategic plan less than 2 weeks before hurricane season
top_comments: Hey Florida, guess what's about to happen..
Fucking. Egomaniac. MAGA. Assholes

They mention a "smaller footprint".  FEMA used to cover the entire United States.  I wonder if they mean that only red states will get aid or nobody will?  Does anyone think they will come up with a new strategic plan or just fold like a cheap suit?

I always feel bad for the voters in these red states that literally did not vote for this. About 4.7 million Floridians voted for Kamala. Those folks also all bear the brunt of the other side’s short-sightedness. These states are purple. Not red or blue. There is no “mandate,” only madness.
Is there a word for when you're intentionally incompetent with the purpose of watching poor people die for amusement?

"The memo authored by Richardson was brief — the new agency head now requires that all FEMA memos to, from or for his office be no longer than one page in length, according to multiple current FEMA employees"

I love how all these assholes don't know how to read and have the attention spans of goldfish.

>The memo authored by Richardson was brief — the new agency head now requires that all FEMA memos to, from or for his office be no longer than one page in length, according to multiple current FEMA employees. 

Should it also includes pictures so that perhaps Mango could understand it if he even looked at it? What even is this kind of rule?
Oh no, all those voters are nearing the Find Out phase, ah geez.
I’m confused. Did the article confirm there is no official FEMA plans yet because the last ones were set to expire? And that their new plans aren’t intended to be revealed until after the summer?
Florida, Alabama, and Mississippi will now reap the benefits on their voting.

posts.title: French paedophile surgeon who abused hundreds sentenced to 20 years in jail.
top_comments: They caught him because he journaled about the abuse in extreme detail. I think that's the part of this that disturbs me the most, the fact that he kept a personal record of what he did and to whom he did it, complete with enough detail that police were able to easily find and notify his victims.
20 years for sexual assault of hundreds of children feels light but he's 74.  He should never be free but at his age 20 years is basically life in prison.

My heart goes out to all the victims, such a horrific story. All those who knew or were aware in their community and in the medical establishment should be so ashamed they allowed this to continue. I am glad the victims finally have some sense of closure and were able to support each other throughout the court proceedings, the one light to come out of such a pitch black case.
It’s terrible what people do to children, especially when they are in a position of trust and they abuse it to push their own beliefs and desires over the child’s best interest

In France if you kill or rape 20 people, you’ll only be sentenced to the maximum time, you’ve been condemned for one case.

Let’s say you received a 15 years sentence for the first victim, and 8 years for a second one, you’ll go to jail for 15 years (the maximum amount time received)
This is even worse than standard pedophile considering the damage to the medical world reputation. Fucking piece of human trash.

With a 20 year sentence, he's likely to die before seeing freedom. But it provides no sense of security, comfort, or justice to his victims, who will suffer lifelong consequences because of his sick and evil actions.
Wait how? Kids should be never alone with him? Either family or nurses or surgeon assistants should be there at all times?!
That’s seems like an awfully light sentence.
Should’ve been the wood chipper

posts.title: Harvard agrees to relinquish early photos of slaves, ending a long legal battle
top_comments:
>Lanier, who lives in Connecticut, sued the Ivy League school in 2019 for “wrongful seizure, possession and expropriation” of the images of Renty, Delia and five other enslaved individuals. The suit attacked Harvard for its “exploitation” of Renty’s image at a 2017 conference and in other uses. It said Harvard has capitalized on the photos by demanding a “hefty” licensing fee to reproduce the images.

That's fucking disgusting. Harvard commissioned the daguerreotypes in order to support the cause of race-based slavery. Then, 175 years later, well after anything resembling a copyright claim could be made, they demanded a licensing fee to reproduce the image of these people.
Timing of these Harvard articles are crazy, it’s like they just had these on ready whenever something goes wrong with Harvard
The trend of profile pics showing instead of a relevant picture always gives me a chuckle.

I mean this happens at almost every rights and reproductions department at every archive, library and museum in North America because of how funding-starved cultural heritage is (even sometimes inside the harvards of the world) .. they shouldn’t charge a licensing fee for public domain works but.. find an MLA that aggressively doesn’t… not too many
Fascinating how there seems to be a new hit piece about Harvard in the news every day since they stood up to Trump and his regime.
I'm guessing the last alumni the photos could've directly harm has finally died.
My heart skipped on the first four words of the headline/title, fearing they went the way of Columbia.
[removed]

Yeah it's shitty that innocent people were enslaved. I don't understand why "ownership" of the photographs are an issue. Copyright has long expired, so why should Harvard or anyone who possesses a copy of the photos have to give them up, it should all be in the public domain now.
Another reason they should not be federally funded

lol the one good thing that was implemented under Musk’s ownership is now gone. What has he actually done to make that site better than it was before?
And he wonders why he's despised so much.
I did Nazi that coming!
I'm really glad I deleted my account a couple of months ago.

Mr. Musk is an excellent case study in narcissistic personality disorder.  This in and of itself is nothing unusual in the world of business a cutthroat ruthless attitude is (in general) rewarded but at least most of them understand you have to go through the motions of pretending to care about ordinary people.  

We all have an Elon Musk in our lives the guy who never admits when he is wrong and only wants to hear good things about himself most of us know to avoid that person where possible.  

Unfortunately for all of us Mr. Musk is impossible to avoid because he is so close to the center of power...he will use his money and influence to tilt things his way for years.
Oh, so X is going to take responsorbility for and do the task themselves?

> According to online records, Penn, 46, was arrested on Sunday and released on $2,000 bail. He was arrested again and placed on $1,000 bail on Monday, per online records. 

If you get arrested, bail out, and then get arrested again the next day for doing the same or similar thing, bail should be off the table.
In the next few years, it's going to become clearer and clearer just how brutal MMA is to fighters' brains. It's getting sad to be a longtime fan, and seeing your heroes go out like this.

It was very apparent this guy is not mentally all there when he was on Joe Rogan with Tulsi Gabbard not too long ago
I met him when I lived in Hawaii about fifteen years ago and he didn't seem "right" then. Ironically it was at an army mma event so there was plenty of CTE going around so he fit in perfectly.
I hope he gets the help he needs. It's obvious he's suffered some CTE.
He’s clearly suffering from Capgras Syndrome and has been for a while.
Bj was always nuts. I grew up the same town.

posts.title: US to ban foreign officials over 'flagrant censorship' on social media
top_comments: Just another double standard by the folks that live by double standards.

> Some foreign officials have taken "flagrant censorship actions against U.S. tech companies and U.S. citizens and residents when they have no authority to do so," Rubio said.

> > no authority to do so


Good luck with that.

Its fucking astonishing to see the US fall from grace like that.

From the outside it looks like your government is doing their best to dismantle the US as we know it.
Little Marco is a waste of space.

Such hypocricy, in view of how Social Media posts are now being used by the US Government to silence disagreeing points of view:

*"Trump officials have repeatedly weighed in on European politics to denounce what they see as suppression of right-wing politicians, including in Romania, Germany and France, accusing European authorities of censoring views like criticism of immigration in the name of countering disinformation."*  

*"In April, Rubio shut down a State Department office that had sought to counter foreign disinformation, accusing it of censorship and wasting U.S. taxpayer money."*

What these idiots don't realize, or respect is that there are laws on the books in Europe pertaining to this right wing bullshit. They've had first hand experience with it before, remember? That's why they censor or suppress it because they're smart enough to remember what happens when it's left unchecked..

The Administration also announced they are pausing student visas so they can have more time to comb through applicants' social media to ensure they don't say anything the administration doesn't like. Seems like Trump needs to practice what he preaches.
What in the fucking hell is Trump trying to accomplish?
Oh no the rest of the world will not allow BS to be heard in their country. Ok
My guess is they're just fine not coming here.
They are talking about protecting the speech of other facist regimes the silencing of Nazi groups in Germany and apartheid era groups in South Africa.

*"Trump officials have repeatedly weighed in on European politics to denounce what they see as suppression of right-wing politicians, including in Romania, Germany and France, accusing European authorities of censoring views like criticism of immigration in the name of countering disinformation."*  

*"In April, Rubio shut down a State Department office that had sought to counter foreign disinformation, accusing it of censorship and wasting U.S. taxpayer money."*

What these idiots don't realize, or respect is that there are laws on the books in Europe pertaining to this right wing bullshit. They've had first hand experience with it before, remember? That's why they censor or suppress it because they're smart enough to remember what happens when it's left unchecked..

The Administration also announced they are pausing student visas so they can have more time to comb through applicants' social media to ensure they don't say anything the administration doesn't like. Seems like Trump needs to practice what he preaches.

Oh no the rest of the world will not allow BS to be heard in their country. Ok
My guess is they're just fine not coming here.
They are talking about protecting the speech of other facist regimes the silencing of Nazi groups in Germany and apartheid era groups in South Africa.

posts.title: Harvard agrees to relinquish early photos of slaves, ending a long legal battle
top_comments:
>Lanier, who lives in Connecticut, sued the Ivy League school in 2019 for “wrongful seizure, possession and expropriation” of the images of Renty, Delia and five other enslaved individuals. The suit attacked Harvard for its “exploitation” of Renty’s image at a 2017 conference and in other uses. It said Harvard has capitalized on the photos by demanding a “hefty” licensing fee to reproduce the images.

That's fucking disgusting. Harvard commissioned the daguerreotypes in order to support the cause of race-based slavery. Then, 175 years later, well after anything resembling a copyright claim could be made, they demanded a licensing fee to reproduce the image of these people.
Timing of these Harvard articles are crazy, it’s like they just had these on ready whenever something goes wrong with Harvard
The trend of profile pics showing instead of a relevant picture always gives me a chuckle.

I mean this happens at almost every rights and reproductions department at every archive, library and museum in North America because of how funding-starved cultural heritage is (even sometimes inside the harvards of the world) .. they shouldn’t charge a licensing fee for public domain works but.. find an MLA that aggressively doesn’t… not too many
Fascinating how there seems to be a new hit piece about Harvard in the news every day since they stood up to Trump and his regime.
I'm guessing the last alumni the photos could've directly harm has finally died.
My heart skipped on the first four words of the headline/title, fearing they went the way of Columbia.
[removed]

Yeah it's shitty that innocent people were enslaved. I don't understand why "ownership" of the photographs are an issue. Copyright has long expired, so why should Harvard or anyone who possesses a copy of the photos have to give them up, it should all be in the public domain now.
Another reason they should not be federally funded
